HOME.SEARCH_FIELD_PLACEHOLDER: Fr Search Job or Work Order

COMMON.DASHBOARD_PAGE: Fr This is the Dashboard page!

ACTIVITYGRID.PROGRESS_BAR: Fr Loading results for Site {{completed}} of {{total}}.

CONTEXTHELP.CONTEXTHELPVIDEOLINK: Fr FMP Quick Help 365 Video channel

EQUIPMENTSEARCHPANEL.BODY: Fr Equipment Search Panel Body Text

SEARCHFUNCTIONALITY.BODY:
• From: The starting date (Qtrac Last Updated By Date, visible on Status Board & Shipping Monitor) for your search

  • To: The end date (Qtrac Last Updated By Date) for your search

  • TCO: A multi-select drop-down to choose specific TCO#s

  • Job: A multi-select drop-down to choose specific Job#s

SAVESEARCH.BODY:
Fr
  • Instead of repeatedly entering the above criteria, frequently applied searches can be saved under this section. Enter a name to save your custom search in the text field provided.

  • Reset: clears the search criteria fields

  • Search: on clicking upon this button, the applied search criteria takes into effect and displays the respective result on the grid.

LAYOUTDROPDOWN.BODY:
Fr
  • Layout Chooser: Change your current layout from the drop-down list by clicking here and selecting the layout name.

  • Layout Panel: To alter the current layout or to create a new one click on Manage Grid Views.

COLUMNOPTIONS.BODY:
Fr
  • Add New Link: Opens the text box in 4b to name the new template created on the currently selected one.

  • Text Box: type in the name of your new view to be created.

  • The gripper icon: is used to rearrange the position a column on the data grid

  • The lock icon: can be toggled to fix or unfix (unlock) the position of a column on the grid. Locked columns move to the left of the grid by default.

  • Delete Column Button: The red ‘X’ icon removes the corresponding column from the view.

  • Add Column Button: A text box appears upon clicking here where you can either enter a column name, or select one from the menu that appears

COLUMNOPTIONSDATA.BODY:
fr
  • Add New Link: Opens the text box to name the new template created on the currently selected one.
  • Text Box: Type in the name of your new view to be created
  • The gripper icon: It is used to rearrange the position of a column on the data grid.
  • The lock icon: It can be toggled to fix or unfix (unlock) the position of a column on the grid. Locked columns move to the left of the grid by default.
  • Delete Column Button: The red ‘X’ icon removes the corresponding column from the view.
  • Add Column Button: A text box appears upon clicking here where you can either enter a column name or select one from the menu that appears.

GROUPING.BODY:
fr
  • To group data based on a particular column in the grid, drag the column name and place it on the grouping header which is highlighted by the tooltip.
  • Once the column name appears inside a white elliptical box with a blue outline here, the grid data is grouped on its basis.
  • To remove any grouping, click on the X icon in the elliptical box.
  • To rearrange the grouping hierarchy, drag and place the elliptical box of the required column.

SORTING.BODY:
fr
  • Grid Data can be sorted at two levels:
    • a. Column Level: applies to columns that are not grouped. Click on Select the column name to toggle the type of sort or to remove it. If sorted, one of the following icons will appear next to the column name:
    • : Ascending Order Ascending Order
    • : Descending Order
    • or : where n is a number representing the order of sorting in case sorting is applied on multiple columns
    • b. Group Level: By default, ascending order is applied to grouped columns. This can be toggled but NOT REMOVED by clicking on the elliptically boxed column name.

FILTERING.BODY:
fr
  • Type in the white space or select it to trigger filtering options.
  • Depending on the column, the type of filter can be one of the following:
    • a. Multi Select: indicated by a blank space with no icon
    • b. Date filter: indicated by a calendar icon
    • c. Boolean Filter: indicated by an (All) option with icon
    • d. Default filter: indicated by the funnel icon

TEMPORARYCOLREARRANGEMENT.BODY:
fr
  • To further customize your current view, column positions can be changed without having to open the Column Options Panel.
  • This can be achieved by clicking on Selecting the column you want to reposition and dragging it to the place of interest.
  • By default, this column arrangement will not be saved as part of the current layout configuration. To save the new column order layout as part of the current view, open the column options panel and select the save button.

EDITABLEFIELDS.BODY:
fr
  • Activity Monitor consists of 9 editable fields* in total.
  • Eight correspond to Qtrac data points and one is a newly introduced quantity called EDO Priority.
  • These editable fields* can be categorized at two levels:
    • a. TCO (EDP) Level: Planned Ship Date, TLM Ship Date, Priority, TCO Comments, Shipping Instructions and Maintenance & Operations.
    • b. TCO (EDP) Level: Next Ship Date, TLM Actual Ship Date, EDO Priority
  • *  Out of these fields, the ones available for editing for your assigned role will be displayed in a white background on the grid.

TIMEZONE.BODY: Fr Displays your current time zone in which you will see data on the grid.

UNITSYSTEM.BODY: Fr Units of measurement can be changed upon clicking on this drop down and choosing your preferred option.

ERROR.RETRYERROR: FR Retry count excceeded for GUID Api
ERROR.MATEOAPINOTFOUND: FR Mateo Api Response - Not Found

FMP_WIKI.BODY:
1. a. FMP Wiki
  2. b. FMP Quick Help O365 Video channel

COLUMNOPTIONS.MESSAGE: Fr To change the column order, drag and drop a field. To lock a column and move to front of list,click the lock icon.
